title: cla_dtree
code: # preparing dataset for random sampling set.seed(1) sr <- sample_random() sr <- train_test(sr, iris) iris_train = sr$train iris_test = sr$test tbl <- rbind(table(iris[,"Species"]),               table(iris_train[,"Species"]),               table(iris_test[,"Species"])) rownames(tbl) <- c("dataset", "training", "test") head(tbl) #>          setosa versicolor virginica #> dataset      50         50        50 #> training     39         38        43 #> test         11         12         7

previous_headings: DAL Package > Building samples (training and testing)
title: cla_dtree
code: model <- cla_dtree("Species", slevels) print(describe(model)) #> [1] "cla_dtree" model <- fit(model, iris_train) #> cla_dtree,0.000 train_prediction <- predict(model, iris_train)    iris_train_predictand = RSNNS::decodeClassLabels(iris_train[,"Species"]) train_eval <- evaluation.classification(iris_train_predictand, train_prediction) print(train_eval$metrics) #>    accuracy    f1 sensitivity specificity precision recall #> 1 0.9833333 0.975       0.975      0.9875     0.975  0.975 rc <- roc_curve(iris_train_predictand, train_prediction) plot(rc)

code: # preparing dataset for random sampling sr <- sample_random() sr <- train_test(sr, iris) train <- sr$train test <- sr$test  # hyper parameter setup tune <- cla_tune(cla_mlp("Species", levels(iris$Species))) ranges <- list(size=c(3:5), decay=c(0.1))  # hyper parameter optimization model <- fit(tune, train, ranges)  # testing optimization test_prediction <- predict(model, test) test_predictand <- adjust_class_label(test[,"Species"]) test_eval <- evaluate(model, test_predictand, test_prediction) test_eval$metrics #>   accuracy TP TN FP FN precision recall sensitivity specificity f1 #> 1        1 12 18  0  0         1      1           1           1  1

title: Plot a time series chart with predictions — plot_ts_pred
Plot a time series chart with predictions — plot_ts_pred
code: data(sin_data) ts <- ts_data(sin_data$y, 0) ts_head(ts, 3) #>             t0 #> [1,] 0.0000000 #> [2,] 0.2474040 #> [3,] 0.4794255   samp <- ts_sample(ts, test_size= 5) io_train <- ts_projection(samp$train) io_test <- ts_projection(samp$test)  model <- ts_arima() model <- fit(model, x=io_train$input, y=io_train$output) adjust <- predict(model, io_train$input)  prediction <- predict(model, x=io_test$input, steps_ahead=5) prediction <- as.vector(prediction)  yvalues <- c(io_train$output, io_test$output) grf <- plot_ts_pred(y=yvalues, yadj=adjust, ypre=prediction) plot(grf)

title: k-fold training and test partition object — train_test_from_folds
text: returns list two elements: train: data frame containing combined data folds except k-th fold, used training set. test: data frame corresponding k-th fold, used test set.

title: k-fold training and test partition object — train_test_from_folds
code: # Create k-fold partitions of a dataset (e.g., iris) folds <- k_fold(sample_random(), iris, k = 5)  # Use the first fold as the test set and combine the remaining folds for the training set train_test_split <- train_test_from_folds(folds, k = 1)  # Display the training set head(train_test_split$train) #>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width    Species #> 48          4.6         3.2          1.4         0.2     setosa #> 80          5.7         2.6          3.5         1.0 versicolor #> 7           4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3     setosa #> 81          5.5         2.4          3.8         1.1 versicolor #> 18          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.3     setosa #> 75          6.4         2.9          4.3         1.3 versicolor  # Display the test set head(train_test_split$test) #>     Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width    Species #> 30           4.7         3.2          1.6         0.2     setosa #> 78           6.7         3.0          5.0         1.7 versicolor #> 56           5.7         2.8          4.5         1.3 versicolor #> 68           5.8         2.7          4.1         1.0 versicolor #> 12           4.8         3.4          1.6         0.2     setosa #> 134          6.3         2.8          5.1         1.5  virginica

title: ARIMA — ts_arima
text: Creates time series prediction object uses AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA). wraps forecast library.

title: ARIMA — ts_arima
code: ts_arima()

title: ARIMA — ts_arima
code: data(sin_data) ts <- ts_data(sin_data$y, 0) ts_head(ts, 3) #>             t0 #> [1,] 0.0000000 #> [2,] 0.2474040 #> [3,] 0.4794255  samp <- ts_sample(ts, test_size = 5) io_train <- ts_projection(samp$train) io_test <- ts_projection(samp$test)  model <- ts_arima() model <- fit(model, x=io_train$input, y=io_train$output)  prediction <- predict(model, x=io_test$input[1,], steps_ahead=5) prediction <- as.vector(prediction) output <- as.vector(io_test$output)  ev_test <- evaluate(model, output, prediction) ev_test #> $values #> [1]  0.41211849  0.17388949 -0.07515112 -0.31951919 -0.54402111 #>  #> $prediction #> [1] 0.6011374 0.5784414 0.5566023 0.5355877 0.5153665 #>  #> $smape #> [1] 1.489711 #>  #> $mse #> [1] 0.4904025 #>  #> $R2 #> [1] -3.235632 #>  #> $metrics #>         mse    smape        R2 #> 1 0.4904025 1.489711 -3.235632 #>

title: Time Series Tune — ts_tune
code: data(sin_data) ts <- ts_data(sin_data$y, 10) ts_head(ts, 3) #>             t9        t8        t7        t6        t5        t4        t3 #> [1,] 0.0000000 0.2474040 0.4794255 0.6816388 0.8414710 0.9489846 0.9974950 #> [2,] 0.2474040 0.4794255 0.6816388 0.8414710 0.9489846 0.9974950 0.9839859 #> [3,] 0.4794255 0.6816388 0.8414710 0.9489846 0.9974950 0.9839859 0.9092974 #>             t2        t1        t0 #> [1,] 0.9839859 0.9092974 0.7780732 #> [2,] 0.9092974 0.7780732 0.5984721 #> [3,] 0.7780732 0.5984721 0.3816610  samp <- ts_sample(ts, test_size = 5) io_train <- ts_projection(samp$train) io_test <- ts_projection(samp$test)  tune <- ts_tune(input_size=c(3:5), base_model = ts_elm(ts_norm_gminmax())) ranges <- list(nhid = 1:5, actfun=c('purelin'))  # Generic model tunning model <- fit(tune, x=io_train$input, y=io_train$output, ranges)  prediction <- predict(model, x=io_test$input[1,], steps_ahead=5) prediction <- as.vector(prediction) output <- as.vector(io_test$output)  ev_test <- evaluate(model, output, prediction) ev_test #> $values #> [1]  0.41211849  0.17388949 -0.07515112 -0.31951919 -0.54402111 #>  #> $prediction #> [1]  0.41211849  0.17388949 -0.07515112 -0.31951919 -0.54402111 #>  #> $smape #> [1] 3.516681e-13 #>  #> $mse #> [1] 1.012475e-26 #>  #> $R2 #> [1] 1 #>  #> $metrics #>            mse        smape R2 #> 1 1.012475e-26 3.516681e-13  1 #>

title: Z-score normalization — zscore
code: data(iris) head(iris) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa  trans <- zscore() trans <- fit(trans, iris) tiris <- transform(trans, iris) head(tiris) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1   -0.8976739  1.01560199    -1.335752   -1.311052  setosa #> 2   -1.1392005 -0.13153881    -1.335752   -1.311052  setosa #> 3   -1.3807271  0.32731751    -1.392399   -1.311052  setosa #> 4   -1.5014904  0.09788935    -1.279104   -1.311052  setosa #> 5   -1.0184372  1.24503015    -1.335752   -1.311052  setosa #> 6   -0.5353840  1.93331463    -1.165809   -1.048667  setosa  itiris <- inverse_transform(trans, tiris) head(itiris) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa
